content.raw: I think `gzlog` is ok, since the messages go to `~/.gazebo/test.log` for anything that uses ServerFixture.hh. Only the log from the most recent test is saved. Also, there's messages going there anyway from `World.cc` and `Link.cc`.
content.html: I think gzlog is ok, since the messages go to ~/.gazebo/test.log for anything that uses ServerFixture.hh. Only the log from the most recent test is saved. Also, there's messages going there anyway from World.cc and Link.cc.

pull_request.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

pullrequest.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

content.raw:
I'm confused about how this is supposed to work. The first thing this will do is save the applied `_force`. Then `Joint::SetForce` is called, which checks the bounds of `_index` and applies some limits to the force input (so which value do we want to save, the clamped or unclamped?). However, the clamping that `Joint::SetForce` does is only applied to a local variable, and the unclamped `_force` is then passed to `SetForceImpl`.

This might take a fair bit of refactoring to fix.
content.html:
I'm confused about how this is supposed to work. The first thing this will do is save the applied _force. Then Joint::SetForce is called, which checks the bounds of _index and applies some limits to the force input (so which value do we want to save, the clamped or unclamped?). However, the clamping that Joint::SetForce does is only applied to a local variable, and the unclamped _force is then passed to SetForceImpl.

This might take a fair bit of refactoring to fix.
